packages.description:
## Package Overview

This package provides a listener JWT authentication provider, which can be used to authenticate the provided credentials against the provided JWT validator configurations, and a client self-signed JWT authentication provider, which can be used to authenticate against an external endpoint with a self-signed JWT issued against the provided JWT issuer configurations. Also, this module provides the functionality related to issuing and validating a JWT.

For information on the operations, which you can perform with this module, see the below **Functions**. For examples on the usage of the operations, see the following.
 * [JWT Issue/Validate Example](https://ballerina.io/learn/by-example/jwt-issue-validate.html)
 * [HTTP Service with JWT Auth Example](https://ballerina.io/learn/by-example/http-service-with-jwt-auth.html)
 * [HTTP Client with Self Signed JWT Auth Example](https://ballerina.io/learn/by-example/http-client-with-self-signed-jwt-auth.html)
 * [HTTP Client with Bearer Token Auth Example](https://ballerina.io/learn/by-example/http-client-with-bearer-token-auth.html)

fields.name: certFile
fields.description: A file containing the certificate

fields.name: keyFile
fields.description: A file containing the private key

fields.name: keyPassword
fields.description: Password of the private key (if encrypted)

records.name: CertKey
records.description: Represents combination of certificate, private key and private key password if encrypted.

fields.name: httpVersion
fields.description: The HTTP version of the client

fields.name: secureSocket
fields.description: SSL/TLS-related configurations

records.name: ClientConfiguration
records.description: Represents the configurations of the client used to call the JWKS endpoint.

fields.name: alg
fields.description: Cryptographic algorithm used to secure the JWS

fields.name: typ
fields.description: Media type of the JWT

fields.name: cty
fields.description: Content type, convey structural information about the JWT

fields.name: kid
fields.description: Key ID, hint indicating which key was used to secure the JWS

fields.name: username
fields.description: JWT username, which is mapped to the `sub`

fields.name: issuer
fields.description: JWT issuer, which is mapped to the `iss`

fields.name: audience
fields.description: JWT audience, which is mapped to the `aud`

fields.name: jwtId
fields.description: JWT ID, which is mapped to the `jti`

fields.name: keyId
fields.description: JWT key ID, which is mapped the `kid`

fields.name: customClaims
fields.description: Map of custom claims

fields.name: expTime
fields.description: Expiry time in seconds

fields.name: signatureConfig
fields.description: JWT signature configurations

fields.name: algorithm
fields.description: Cryptographic signing algorithm for JWS

fields.name: config
fields.description: KeyStore configurations or private key configurations

fields.name: iss
fields.description: Issuer, identifies the principal that issued the JWT

fields.name: sub
fields.description: Subject, identifies the principal that is the subject of the JWT

fields.name: aud
fields.description: Audience, identifies the recipients that the JWT is intended for

fields.name: jti
fields.description: JWT ID, unique identifier for the JWT

fields.name: exp
fields.description: Expiration time, identifies the expiration time (seconds since the Epoch) on or after which the JWT must not be accepted

fields.name: nbf
fields.description: Not before, identifies the time (seconds since the Epoch) before which the JWT must not be accepted

fields.name: iat
fields.description: Issued at, identifies the time (seconds since the Epoch) at which the JWT was issued

fields.name: disable
fields.description: Disable SSL validation

fields.name: cert
fields.description: Configurations associated with the `crypto:TrustStore` or single certificate file that the client trusts

fields.name: key
fields.description: Configurations associated with the `crypto:KeyStore` or combination of certificate and private key of the client

fields.name: issuer
fields.description: Expected issuer, which is mapped to the `iss`

fields.name: audience
fields.description: Expected audience, which is mapped to the `aud`

fields.name: clockSkew
fields.description: Clock skew (in seconds) that can be used to avoid token validation failures due to clock synchronization problems

fields.name: signatureConfig
fields.description: JWT signature configurations

fields.name: cacheConfig
fields.description: Configurations related to the cache, which are used to store parsed JWT information

fields.name: jwksConfig
fields.description: JWKS configurations

fields.name: certFile
fields.description: Public certificate file

fields.name: trustStoreConfig
fields.description: JWT TrustStore configurations

methods.name: init
methods.description: Provides authentication based on the provided JWT configurations.

returnParameters.description: Generated token or else an `auth:Error` if token can't be generated

methods.name: generateToken
methods.description:
Issues a self-signed JWT for authentication.
```ballerina
string|auth:Error token = provider.generateToken();
```

initMethod.name: init
initMethod.description: Provides authentication based on the provided JWT configurations.

returnParameters.description: Generated token or else an `auth:Error` if token can't be generated

otherMethods.name: generateToken
otherMethods.description:
Issues a self-signed JWT for authentication.
```ballerina
string|auth:Error token = provider.generateToken();
```

classes.name: ClientSelfSignedJwtAuthProvider

methods.name: init
methods.description: Provides authentication based on the provided JWT.

returnParameters.description: `jwt:Payload` if authentication is successful or else an `auth:Error` if JWT validation failed

methods.name: authenticate
methods.description:
Authenticates provided JWT against `jwt:ValidatorConfig`.
```ballerina
boolean|auth:Error result = provider.authenticate("<credential>");
```

initMethod.name: init
initMethod.description: Provides authentication based on the provided JWT.

returnParameters.description: `jwt:Payload` if authentication is successful or else an `auth:Error` if JWT validation failed

otherMethods.name: authenticate
otherMethods.description:
Authenticates provided JWT against `jwt:ValidatorConfig`.
```ballerina
boolean|auth:Error result = provider.authenticate("<credential>");
```

classes.name: ListenerJwtAuthProvider

parameters.name: jwt
parameters.description: JWT that needs to be decoded

returnParameters.description: The `jwt:Header` and `jwt:Payload` as a  tuple or else a `jwt:Error` if token decoding fails

functions.name: decode
functions.description:
Decodes the provided JWT string.
```ballerina
[jwt:Header, jwt:Payload]|jwt:Error [header, payload] = jwt:decode(jwt);
```

returnParameters.description: JWT as a `string` or else a `jwt:Error` if token issuing fails

functions.name: issue
functions.description:
Issues a JWT based on the provided configurations. JWT will be signed (JWS) if `crypto:KeyStore` information is
provided in the `jwt:KeyStoreConfig` and the `jwt:SigningAlgorithm` is not `jwt:NONE`.
```ballerina
string|jwt:Error jwt = jwt:issue(issuerConfig);
```

parameters.name: jwt
parameters.description: JWT that needs to be validated

returnParameters.description: `jwt:Payload` or else a `jwt:Error` if token validation fails

functions.name: validate
functions.description:
Validates the provided JWT, against the provided configurations.
```ballerina
jwt:Payload|jwt:Error result = jwt:validate(jwt, validatorConfig);
```

errors.name: Error
errors.description:
Represents the JWT error. This will be returned if an error occurred while issuing/validating a JWT or any operation
related to JWT.

types.name: SigningAlgorithm
types.description: The cryptographic algorithms used to secure the JWS.

packages.name: jwt
packages.summary: This package provides a listener JWT authentication provider, which can be used to authenticate the provided credentials against the provided JWT validator configurations, and a client self-signed JWT authentication provider, which can be used to authenticate against an external endpoint with a self-signed JWT issued against the provided JWT issuer configurations. Also, this module provides the functionality related to issuing and validating a JWT.

classes.description:
Represents the client JWT Auth provider, which is used to authenticate with an external endpoint by issuing a
self-signed JWT.
Represents the listener JWT Auth provider, which authenticates by validating a JWT.

functions.description: Issues a JWT based on the provided configurations.
Validates the provided JWT, against the provided configurations.

records.description: Represents combination of certificate, private key and private key password if encrypted.
Represents the configurations of the client used to call the JWKS endpoint.

types.description: The cryptographic algorithms used to secure the JWS.
